New Records: Paul Skenes has already blown past the franchise’s rookie strikeout record, now sitting at 167.
Skenes is the first pitcher in the Modern Era with 150 strikeouts and an ERA under 2.00 in his first 22 career games.
Key Match Events: Paul Skenes had a nine-strikeout performance, helping the Pirates beat the Reds 2-0.
Skenes' changeup was particularly effective, with the Reds whiffing on all seven swings they took against it.
Post-Match Reflections: Reds manager David Bell noted that Skenes' changeup was a difference maker in the game.
Pirates manager Derek Shelton endorsed Skenes for the National League Rookie of the Year, citing his historic performance.
Skenes expressed that winning the Rookie of the Year award would be a cool honor, especially in his first professional season.
